text:
Sampled at the Klosterbräustuberl in Mallersdorf.
Thick and fluffy off white head. Clear solid yellow color. Mild malty aroma. Malty ttaste with alcohol present in the taste. Medium body.

Flasche (50 cl) von der Klosterbrauerei, bestellt über Biershop Bayern. - Orangegelb, trüb. - Nase füllig malzsüß mit weicher Hefe und ganz mildem fruchtig-herbem Hopfen im Hintergrund, Noten von Heu und Pfirsichkernen. - Antrunk breit hellmalzig und sehr süß, beinahe zuckersüß, leicht honigartig, aber durch herb-fruchtige Noten (Bittermandel, Aprikose) aufgelockert. Mild rezent, sahnig weich im Mund. Im Abgang deutliche grasige Hopfenbittere, die sich mit der immer noch beträchtlichen Malzsüße reibt. Schwach krautig-herber Nachtrunk. - Sehr malzsüßer Fastenbock mit enormem Restzuckergehalt, trotzdem nicht klebrig süß, sondern dank perfekt abgestimmter fruchtiger Herbe sehr rund und enorm süffig. Eigenwillige aber auf ihre Weise vollkommen überzeugende Bockbier-Variation.
Swing top bottle @ In de Wildeman. Blonde, hazy. Floral maltyaroma. Malty yet dry flavor with floral notes and a hint of butter cookies. Satisfyingly hopped. Good stuff.

Small sample from bottle at In de Wildeman shared by Bierkoning. Pours hazy yellow with a medium white head. Aroma has some wheat, citrus and is a bit bready. Taste is also bready with some malts, citrus, banana and yeast. Medium body and carbo. Quite nice.

Bottle @ In De Wildeman, share by bierkoning, with benzai, joes & TheJvd. Cloudy golden blonde color. Nice white head with good retention. Aromas: grassy hops, grain, light fruit. Caramel sweetness retronasal. Flavor is moderate sweet, malty. Medium bodied. Finishes dry and slightly bitter. Solid German heller (doppel) Bock.

Bottle shared by bierkoning @ In de Wildeman. Hazy yellow color, medium sized off-white head that lasts for quite a while. Smell and taste some banana, a bit sweet. I dont get much more really. A bit nicer than moest doppelbocks Ive had though.

Bottle.
Pours golden with a big white head. 
A clean and for a double bock, light brew.
Sweet maltyness and low bitterness, drinkable.

50cl Bottle at Café Brecht. Cloudy golden colour with a huge rocky white head. Aroma of malt, wheat, banana, citrus, herbal hops. Flavour is quite sweet, malty, lemon, herbal bitterness, banana, sweet apple, honey, firm bitter finish. Medium-bodied, smooth. Really nice.

0,5 l swing top bottle BB 06/14 
floral, grass, hay, cereal, barnyard, leaves, alcohol, golden, hazy, rocky head, white foam, heavy cloying sweetness, lightly bitter, lightly sour, full body, oily feel, slick feel, sticky, fizzy, long finish,

At Amsterdsam Meibockfest 2014 as Schwester Doris Fastenbock. Poured hazy golden with a thick white head. Aroma of sweet caramel malt and light berries. Medium body, flavour is medium sweet, medium bitter, slight roastyness and some honey sweetness.

Bottled at Eat at Jos, Amsterdam
Golden with a huge, white head. 
Sweet and malty aroma. Rather soapy. 
Slightly vinous flavour. 
Very smooth mouthfeel. 
Sweet. Almost sugary. Some dried fruits; fig, raisins.
Süß-saftiger Doppelbock, der ordentlich vanillin und mit viel Honig daherkommt. Durchaus trinkbar, aber bisweilen schwer und ranzig. Dennoch vollkommen in Ordnung.

Bottle. Pours golden, slightly hazy with a big white head. Sweet, fruity aroma with notes of citrus, pear, honey and mild clove. Sweet, doughy taste with a flowery, citrusy and cesty hoppiness. Also notes of honey. Some alcohol in the aftertaste. A bit too carbonated.

Bottle from Günther - thank you a lot! The Doppelbock pours out in a cloudy deep yellow-golden colour with steady big head and smooth body. Aroma of malt and caramel. Taste of cake, malt, brown sugar, leaves, roasted barley and honey. Very sweet finish. Nice one.
Goldenes Bier mit schöner Schaumkrone. Geruch sehr malzig fruchtig, würzig. Geschmack intensiv malzig, fruchtig, Karamell, würzig.

Thanks to Guenther (pivnizub) for this brew! Pours a clear golden yellow with an off white head that goes pretty quickly to a ring. Smell is grain, sweet light malt, caramel and some light fruit. Taste is a nice blend of crisp hops, caramel and fruit ending dry and crisp with a hint of alcohol as well. Medium body with tickling carbonation. A nice light, hoppy dobblebock that I feel lucky to have tried!

Swing-top bottle, thanks Hart 03/02/13. Pours a hazy golden orange with a small, white, long-lasting head. Aroma is fairly sweet with orange, grain and orange peel. Quite vinous. Sherry as well. Taste is vinous too. Orange is prevalent as is wine gum. Light grain. Quite a bit of honey and sherry as well. Delicious. Palate is oily, somewhat carbonated, a bit mouth stickying. A superb beer.
Pours an golden coloured brew with small white head. Slight smoked malt nose first, then dried fruits, coffee, sherry. Nice complex composition, harmonic impression!

Bottle, danke Günther! I was cheated, I thought I was opening a Kellerbier, oh well that will teach me to read the label. Looks like a nice ungespundetes though: Cloudy yellow, fine carbonation, rocky white head. Fairly honeyish aroma, cant quite hide the strength, also a hint butterscotch. Minerally entry, fruity calvados notes, aromatic hop play, light citric orangepeel in the finish. Fullbodied, pleasant mouthfeel. Unusual, rough, but tasty Doppelbock.

Bottle, tisice dekovnych dopisu, Guenther. Hazy golden color with medium white head. Caramel malt, honey, biscuits, bitter hops in aroma. Taste, honey, biscuits, sweet malt, bitter hops, alcohol. Alcoholic bittersweet finish. Excellent, well balanced Doppelbock. Respect, sister Doris.

old-fashioned swing-top-bottle from biershop-bayern. Clear golden colour, mid-sized white head leaving lacework. Intensively aromatic, sweet malty background with an alcoholic touch, intensive aromatic and bitter hops from the beginning, thus with a bitter-sweet overall character. Delicious.

(swing-top-bottle) Clear, golden colour with a dense and slightly off-white medium-sized foamy head. Delicately bready malty aroma with hints of biscuits and herbal, as well as subtle fruity hops. Moderately sweet and slightly bitter flavour, medium to full bodied with a soft and well-matured carbonation. Hearty malt-character with notes of biscuits, honey, a subtle fruity touch and a well-embedded hoppy bitterness; lingering malty and rounded hoppy finish. Very balanced and delicious pale Doppelbock. 03.III.12

UPDATED: APR 7, 2012 Old-fashioned Bügelverschlußflasche: Clear, golden, creamy & lacy white head, moderate aromas of bisquits, pale malt in the nose, including a nutty and a barnyardy touch; moderate to solid sweet-bitter flavour, medium bodied, very smooth with a silky MF; well balanced sweet-bitter finish with bisquits and malt, again, followed by a hoppy aftertaste. Devilishly moreish

Bottle 50cl. Pours an oily,  bright clear, deep golden appetising brew with a huge durable white head. Very nice appearance in the glass. Tasting: Hazelnuts, straw, hints of wild honey and butter toffee. Complex and massive malty body without being too sweet. Longlasting aftertaste, hides alcohol very well. A fantastic brew and the best pale doppelbock i drank so far. Thanks sister Doris!
